post.body:
I highly recommend everyone remove the addresses in hyperlinks because everyone has different installations.

Good:

    [link](/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit)

Bad:

    [link](http://192.168.1.123:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit)
    [link](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit)
    [link](http://proxysite.com:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit)

This doesn't just apply to markdown. Please do this on your zites as well.

Not everyone runs ZNet on localhost.

comment.body: @Martinv: Profiles are huge, so splitting the site up is necessary. But when I changed hubs,  I didn't do it correctly probably so my comments are tied to a dead hub, yet when people click my profile it shows up my new hubs posts (if they download the remnants of blackhub)

yes. That's the beauty of zeronet. Someone a while back had the concept of putting his zeronet on his boat and had it synced up. When anyone from the ship got back to shore it would sync up with the rest of the network. This is a concept idea of course (and he probably got it working but he never updated us on it), but it should work. Zeronet is designed to be as p2p as possible. The only thing currently "required" is the tracker. But I think if we could get zeronet to allow ip addresses to be manually entered and have zeronet save the ip addresses of old peers, the tracker would be unnecessary.
@Martinv: Wouldn't be hard to implement actually. Just add a purge button that deletes your profile from all hubs and the registry. Problem solved: just make a new profile

@Martinv: makes it harder. Youd have to copy the content of your user directory from the old hub you are on, delete all content from other hubs, then stick the copy on the new hub where it will then sync up with everyone once more.

@Martinv: even if you did just delete it all, the only thing you would lose is your posts. Comments and likes are stored on the user's profile that you commented/liked the post on. iirc

Your posts that I've liked and commented on are stored in your profile directory on your hub.
@Yinyue: Not what I mean. I mean feeling like I made it myself.
